title: How epigenetics regulate vital functions from bacteria to humans

title_detail.value: How epigenetics regulate vital functions from bacteria to humans

summary: A new study provides a comparative analysis of the evolution of epigenetic mechanisms from prokaryotes (bacteria) to simple eukaryotes (multi-cellular) to more complex eukaryotes (humans).

summary_detail.value: A new study provides a comparative analysis of the evolution of epigenetic mechanisms from prokaryotes (bacteria) to simple eukaryotes (multi-cellular) to more complex eukaryotes (humans).
